Thanks Kent :-)

  Having looked in more detail at the Common Public Licens=
e (CPL),
under which JUnit is distributed, I think that your summary is cor=
rect.

  If any Windows users could confirm that the JUnit provided in the
=
distribution is "unmodified", then I'll leave it alone and just
grumble und=
er my breath about the lack of support (from Sony Ericsson)
for Linux ;-)

=
  Thanks again.

  Kind regards.

  Jim.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Ke=
nt Mitchell" <kent@...> wrote:
>
> If you take what this says at face value=
 that they are distributing
> "unmodified JUnit Binary code".  So they they=
 must be distributing their
> code as a set of additional modules (jars, cl=
asses) on top of JUnit.  By
> my reading of the license ,they are not requi=
red to distribute the
> source to their work since it is not a "contributio=
n" to the "Program"
> (i.e. JUnit).  So they do have to make the source to =
JUnit available
> (which they seem to be complying with) but they do not ha=
ve to make the
> source code to their additions available.
>  
> I'm not a =
lawyer but I do spend a fair amount of time looking at license
> agreements=
 since our products incorporate open source so I've gotten
> pretty good at=
 reading these things over the years.  Does anyone want to
> educate me on =
where I went wrong with my reasoning?
>  
> Kent
>  
> 
> _________________=
_______________
>

ce you run the exe, which is a self-installer, you get, among other 
> thin=
gs, a text file stating:

***************************

> This Software includes unmodified =
JUnit binary code developed under the

CPL). The terms of the CPL are

licenses/cpl.php
> <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/cpl.php>  . With res=
pect to such
> binary 
> code,
> source code can be obtained by e-mailing d=
evsupport@...
> <mailto:devsupport%40sonyericsson.com> .
> 
> *************=
***********************************************************
> *
> *********=
***************************************************************
> *
> 
> I =
don't have enough brainpower right now to make a legal judgement, just
> 
>=
 adding information.
> 
> David Saff

icsson are behaving badly. They have produced something they call

le JUnit" and they have made it available for download here:
> >
http://dev=
eloper.sonyericsson.com/site/global/docstools/java/p_java.jsp
> >

roblem is, the file is a Windows .exe contained in a .zip.

ood to me on Linux. Aren't they contravening the open

 JUnit by producing their own extension and not

available?

ind regards.
